bibl.title: Letter from H.V. Stirling to Philip Showalter Hench, September 19, 1940

div1.p: Stirling informs Hench that he is not permitted to disclose Lazear's and Carroll's addresses, but will forward Hench's letter to them.

div1.head: Letter from H.V. Stirling to Philip Showalter Hench, September 19, 1940
div1.opener:
VETERANS ADMINISTRATION
VETERANS ADMINISTRATION
WASHINGTON
September 19,1940
YOUR FILE REFERENCE:
IN REPLY REFER TO: DAB-C
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Reference is made to your letter dated August 26, 1940, re-
questing addresses of the widow of Dr. Jesse Lazear and of the family
of Dr. James Carroll, in order that you may communicate with them in
connection with an address you are to make on the conquest of yellow
fever.

With the exception of the amount of pension being paid, all
information contained in the records of the Veterans Administration is
privileged and confidential; therefore, the addresses requested by you
may not be disclosed. However, in view of the nature of your request,
copies of your letter are being forwarded to the widow of Dr. Jesse W.
Lazear and to a member of the family of Major James Carroll.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. V. STIRLING,
Director of Finance.
